replies.context:
From Merriam-Webster:

fly (verb) 
a: to move in or pass through the air with wings 
b: to move through the air or before the wind or through outer space 
c: to float, wave, or soar in the air

Also from Merriam-Webster:

Air definition is - the mixture of invisible odorless tasteless gases (such as nitrogen and oxygen) that surrounds the earth; also : the equivalent mix of gases on another planet.
Read the definition of ‚Äòfly‚Äô again ... the part that says ‚Äúor through outer space‚Äù.  No air is required, so the definition of air is irrelevant.

They are wrong.  Does the earth fly?  Does the moon?  Galaxies, or any celestial bodies?  No.   That part of the definition (through outer space, which has no atmosphere) was not written by anyone with a knowledge of basic science.

replies.context: While the "Planetary Defense Coordination Office" sounds like something from Starship Troopers, tracking asteroids that may hit us someday is an important function. Asteroid impacts have caused havoc in Earth's past, and unlike other natural disasters we have the ability to predict and prevent it.
